intro: Baeckea obovata, commonly known as the broad-leaf baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features oval, glossy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pink and are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Baeckea obovata is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
